(2, 1, 1): Gaul (present-day France, Luxembourg, Belgium, Switzerland, and northern Italy)
(4, 1, 1): Roman Republic annexes Gaul, Gaul becomes a Roman province
(6, 1, 1): Gauls:, Allobroges, Arverni, Atrebates, Bituriges, Caletes, Eburones, Helvetii, Menapii, Morini, Nervii, Nantuates, Remi, Seduni, Sequani, Sotiates, Suessiones, Veliocasses, Veneti, Veragri, Viromandui, other, Germanic:, Aduatuci, Harudes, Marcomanni, Triboci, Vangiones, Nemetes, Sicambri, Suebi, Tencteri, Ubii, Usipetes, Britons and Aquitanian tribes as well as portions of Iberian tribesmen
(8, 0, 1): Gaius Julius Caesar, Titus Labienus, Mark Antony, Quintus Tullius Cicero, Publius Licinius Crassus, Decimus Junius Brutus Albinus, Servius Sulpicius Galba
(8, 1, 1): Vercingetorix, Ambiorix, Indutiomarus, Commius, Ariovistus, Cassivellaunus
(12, 1, 1): Plutarch and Appian:, 1,000,000 Celts killed in hand-to-hand combat, 1,000,000+ Celts enslaved, 430,000 Germans killed (Julius Caesar), 800 towns destroyed
(13, 0, 1): Caesar would also raid Britannia and Germania, but these expeditions never developed into full-scale invasions.
